ground_truth: The Biker approaches, craning down as he draws near. As the crane descends, he momentarily disappears from view over the rise; then suddenly - ROAR - he tops the rise and, with wheels spinning, becomes airborne. He crashes back down to earth in the foreground and roars away. The scene shifts from the desert to a twilight street where the Arizona house is located. The roar of the Biker's engine and the clank of his chains recede as he gradually dissolves into thin air, leaving us looking at the empty street and the faraway Arizona house. Eerily beautiful singing, a woman singing a lullaby, emerges as the receding roar fades. Behind the singing, a droning high-pitched noise is faintly audible. The camera begins to float forward very close to the ground, slowly moving toward the Arizona house. The high-pitched drone becomes less faint under the singing, and the camera accelerates. The drone grows louder, revealing itself to be a human scream as the approach to the Arizona house shows a ladder propped up to a second-story window. As the speed of movement increases, the scream nearly buries the singing. The camera rushes to the house, toward the base of the ladder, drawn in by the sustained scream. Without slowing, it hurtles straight up the ladder, propelled forward by the deafening scream. Reaching the top, it crashes through the white curtains of the open second-story window into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona with her back to us, screaming over the crib. The view rockets toward her as she turns, hands pressed to her ears, mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting shriek, drawing in for an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and wildly vibrating epiglottis. The scene suddenly changes as the scream is cut off. The singing previously covered by the scream becomes audible again. It is now morning, perspiration beads on Hi's forehead, as Ed walks back and forth, gently bouncing the baby and singing it a lullaby. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun, rumbling, begins to rise perceptibly. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder as he stands at his open front door, facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in, and various flashbulbs pop.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The Motorcyclist advances, bending down as he reaches close. As the bird descends, he briefly vanishes from sight over the rise; then suddenly - ROAR - he tops the rise and, with wheels whirling, becomes airborne. He crashes back down to soil in the foreground and roars away. The scene shifts from the wasteland to a twilight avenue where the Arizona dwelling is situated. The roar of the Motorcyclist's engine and the clank of his chains fade as he gradually vanishes into thin atmosphere, leaving us gazing at the vacant avenue and the distant Arizona dwelling. Eerily lovely singing, a woman singing a lullaby, emerges as the fading roar diminishes. Behind the singing, a droning high-pitched sound is faintly audible. The camera starts to glide forward very close to the ground, slowly moving toward the Arizona dwelling. The high-pitched drone becomes less faint under the singing, and the camera accelerates. The drone grows louder, revealing itself to be a human shriek as the approach to the Arizona dwelling shows a ladder propped up to a second-story window. As the speed of movement increases, the shriek nearly buries the singing. The camera rushes to the dwelling, toward the base of the ladder, drawn in by the sustained shriek. Without slowing, it hurtles straight up the ladder, propelled forward by the deafening shriek. Reaching the top, it crashes through the white curtains of the open second-story window into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona with her back to us, shrieking over the crib. The view rockets toward her as she turns, hands pressed to her ears, mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting screech, drawing in for an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and wildly vibrating epiglottis. The scene suddenly changes as the shriek is cut off. The singing previously covered by the shriek becomes audible again. It is now morning, perspiration beads on Hi's forehead, as Ed walks back and forth, gently bouncing the infant and singing it a lullaby. Hi rises from bed as the orange sun, rumbling, begins to ascend perceptibly. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder as he stands at his open front entryway, facing a group of press individuals on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in, and various flashbulbs burst.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The Biker is approached, with him craning down as his approach is made. As the crane descends, he is momentarily hidden from view over the rise; then suddenly - ROAR - the rise is topped by him and, with wheels spinning, he is made airborne. Earth is crashed back down onto by him in the foreground and away is roared by him. The scene is shifted from the desert to a twilight street where the Arizona house stands. The Biker's engine's roar and his chains' clank recede as he gradually dissolves into thin air, leaving us looking at the empty street and the distant Arizona house. Eerily beautiful singing, a woman singing a lullaby, is produced as the receding roar fades. Behind the singing, a droning high-pitched noise faintly becomes audible. The ground is floated very close to by the camera, slowly moving toward the Arizona house. The less faint high-pitched drone is made under the singing, and the camera is accelerated. The drone is made louder, revealing itself as a human scream as the approach to the Arizona house shows a ladder propped up to a second-story window. As the speed of movement is increased, the singing is nearly buried by the scream. The house is rushed to by the camera, toward the base of the ladder, drawn in by the sustained scream. Without slowing, straight up the ladder it hurtles, propelled forward by the deafening scream. The top is reached, and the white curtains of the open second-story window are crashed through into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona with her back to us, screaming over the crib. Toward her, the view is rocketed as she turns, hands pressed to her ears, mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting shriek, drawing in for an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and wildly vibrating epiglottis. The scene is suddenly changed as the scream is cut off. The singing that was previously covered by the scream becomes audible again. It is now morning, perspiration beads on Hi's forehead, as Ed walks back and forth, gently bouncing the baby and singing it a lullaby. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun, rumbling, begins to be perceived as rising. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. Over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder, we see as he stands at his open front door, facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light is over a local TV news camera, glaring in, and various flashbulbs pop.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches, lowering his head as he nears. Disappearing momentarily over a rise, he then reappears—ROAR—becoming airborne before crashing back down and roaring away. The scene transitions from the desert to a twilight street with an Arizona house. The Biker's engine fades into the distance as he vanishes, leaving the street and remote house visible. An eerie lullaby sung by a woman emerges as the roar fades, accompanied by a faint high-pitched drone. The camera glides near the ground, advancing toward the Arizona house as the drone grows louder and becomes a scream, revealing a ladder to a second-story window. As the speed increases, the scream nearly drowns out the singing. The camera races up the ladder, driven by the scream, and crashes through the second-story window into the nursery, showing Florence Arizona screaming over the crib. The view zooms in on her gaping mouth. The scene abruptly shifts, cutting off the scream and revealing the singing again. It's morning, with Hi sweating as Ed paces, gently bouncing the baby and singing a lullaby. Hi rises as the orange sun begins to rise with a rumble, which is abruptly silenced by a strobe's high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee as a flash picture is taken. Nathan Jr., at his open front door, faces press on the porch, lit by a news camera's light and flashbulbs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches, ducking down and momentarily vanishing from view. Suddenly - ROAR - he tops the rise, wheels spinning, and becomes airborne. He lands in the foreground and roars away. The scene shifts from the desert to a twilight street with an Arizona house. The Biker's engine roar and chain clank fade as he dissolves into air, leaving an empty street and distant Arizona house. A woman’s lullaby emerges as the roar fades, with a faint high-pitched drone. The camera floats close to the ground toward the Arizona house as the drone grows louder, becoming a human scream. Approaching the house, a ladder leads to a second-story window. The scream nearly drowns out the singing as the camera rushes to the ladder and climbs it, driven by the deafening scream. It crashes through white curtains into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona, screaming over the crib. It zooms in on her as she turns, hands on ears, mouth wide open in a shriek. The scream abruptly stops; the lullaby becomes audible again. Morning arrives, perspiration on Hi’s forehead, as Ed gently bounces the baby, singing a lullaby. Hi rises as the rumbling orange sun rises. A flash picture cuts off the sun’s rumble, followed by a high-pitched "ba-WEEEEeeee" as Nathan Jr. stands at the open front door, facing press on the porch with an obie light glaring in and flashbulbs popping.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
As the Biker makes his approach, he carefully cranes down, lowering his posture as he gets closer. When the crane of his body descends, he temporarily disappears from sight, hidden from view as he moves over the rise. Then, quite suddenly, with an explosive ROAR, he crests the rise. His wheels spin rapidly as he becomes airborne, momentarily soaring before he crashes back down to the earth in the foreground with a thunderous impact, and then he roars away into the distance. The scene shifts dramatically from the open desert environment to a dimly lit street at twilight, where we find the Arizona house. The Biker's roaring engine and the clanking noise of his chains grow fainter, gradually fading until he seems to dissolve into nothingness, leaving behind only the sight of the empty street and the distant image of the Arizona house.

An eerily beautiful singing begins to emerge, with the haunting voice of a woman crooning a lullaby, as the receding roar of the Biker's presence slowly fades away. Beneath the melodic singing, a droning, high-pitched noise can be faintly heard, steadily becoming more noticeable. The camera starts to glide forward, barely above the ground, as it makes a slow, deliberate advance toward the Arizona house. The high-pitched drone becomes increasingly prominent, gradually gaining strength under the cover of the singing, and the camera starts to pick up speed. As this relentless drone grows louder, it reveals itself to be not just any noise but a chilling human scream, setting the tone as the viewpoint draws closer to the Arizona house, where a ladder leans against the building, leading up to a second-story window. As the pace of movement intensifies, the scream nearly drowns out the lullaby, becoming overwhelmingly dominant. The camera surges toward the house, straight to the base of the ladder, irresistibly pulled in by the ongoing, ear-splitting scream. Without any hesitation, it rushes up the ladder at a relentless pace, driven forward by the deafening, unyielding scream. Reaching the top, the camera bursts through the white curtains of the open second-story window, entering the nursery, where we find Florence Arizona with her back turned to us, caught in the midst of a scream over the crib. The view accelerates toward her as she turns around, hands pressed tightly against her ears, her mouth stretched wide in a shriek so intense it's almost palpable, converging into an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and her wildly vibrating epiglottis.

Suddenly, the scene shifts entirely as the scream is abruptly cut off, and the singing that had been previously obscured by the scream becomes clear once more. It is now the calm of morning, with perspiration glistening on Hi's forehead as Ed gently paces back and forth, tenderly bouncing the baby while softly singing a lullaby. Hi rises from the bed, witnessing the orange sun as it rumbles and begins its perceptible rise in the sky. The rumbling of the sun is suddenly interrupted by the sharp, high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee sound of a strobe light going off as a flash picture is taken. The perspective shifts to observe from over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder as he stands at his open front door, confronted by a group of press people assembled on the porch. An obie light above a local TV news camera shines brightly, glaring in, while various flashbulbs pop and flicker.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
As the Biker approaches, he carefully cranes his head downward, lowering his posture as he gets closer and closer. When the crane of his body descends, he momentarily disappears from sight, hidden from view as he moves over the rise in the terrain. Then, quite suddenly, with an explosive and thunderous ROAR, he crests the rise. His wheels spin rapidly and eagerly as he becomes airborne, soaring for a brief moment before he crashes back down onto the earth in the foreground with a resounding, thunderous impact. After landing, he roars away into the distance, leaving behind a trail of noise. The scene shifts dramatically, transforming from the open desert environment to a dimly lit street enveloped in the soft glow of twilight, where we find the Arizona house standing quietly. The Biker's roaring engine and the metallic clanking noise of his chains grow fainter and fainter, gradually fading away until he seems to dissolve completely into nothingness. This leaves behind only the sight of the empty street and the distant silhouette of the Arizona house.

At this moment, an eerily beautiful singing begins to emerge, with the haunting voice of a woman crooning a melancholic lullaby, as the receding roar of the Biker's presence slowly fades into the background. Beneath the melodic singing, a droning, high-pitched noise can be faintly heard, steadily becoming more noticeable and prominent. The camera starts to glide forward, hovering just above the ground, as it makes a slow and deliberate advance toward the Arizona house. The high-pitched drone becomes increasingly prominent, gradually gaining strength under the cover of the singing, and the camera begins to pick up speed in its movement. As this relentless drone grows louder, it reveals itself to be not just any noise but a chilling and unsettling human scream, setting a tense tone as the viewpoint draws closer and closer to the Arizona house. There, a ladder leans precariously against the building, leading up to a second-story window. As the pace of movement intensifies, the scream nearly drowns out the lullaby, becoming overwhelmingly dominant in the audio landscape. The camera surges toward the house with increasing urgency, straight to the base of the ladder, irresistibly pulled in by the ongoing, ear-splitting scream. Without any hesitation whatsoever, it rushes up the ladder at a relentless pace, driven forward by the deafening, unyielding scream. Upon reaching the top, the camera bursts through the white curtains of the open second-story window, entering the nursery, where we find Florence Arizona with her back turned to us, caught in the midst of a scream that echoes over the crib. The view accelerates toward her as she turns around, her hands pressed tightly against her ears, her mouth stretched wide in a shriek so intense and visceral that it's almost palpable, converging into an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and her wildly vibrating epiglottis.

Suddenly, the scene shifts entirely as the scream is abruptly cut off, and the singing that had been previously obscured by the overwhelming scream becomes clear and distinct once more. It is now the calm of morning, with perspiration glistening on Hi's forehead as Ed gently paces back and forth across the room, tenderly bouncing the baby while softly singing a soothing lullaby. Hi rises slowly from the bed, witnessing the orange sun as it rumbles and begins its perceptible and gradual rise in the vast sky. The gentle rumbling of the sun is suddenly interrupted by the sharp, high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee sound of a strobe light going off as a flash picture is taken. The perspective then shifts to observe from over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder as he stands at his open front door, confronted by a group of eager press people assembled on the porch. An obie light positioned above a local TV news camera shines brightly, glaring in, while various flashbulbs pop and flicker all around.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches, gradually inclining his body and craning his neck down as he draws near, keenly focused on his descent. As the crane descends further, he momentarily disappears from view over the rise, hidden from sight, creating an anticipatory pause. Then, with sudden intensity, a powerful ROAR heralds his emergence as he tops the rise, propelling himself into the air with wheels now spinning rapidly beneath him. He crashes back down to earth in the foreground, the impact echoing as he reestablishes connection with the ground and quickly accelerates to roar away. The scene transitions from the arid, expansive desert to a twilight street where the Arizona house stands, casting shadows in the dimming light. The roar of the Biker's engine, accompanied by the metallic clanking of his chains, gradually fades as he seemingly dissolves into thin air, leaving behind an empty street where the distant Arizona house can be seen. As the sound of the Biker's departure diminishes, eerily beautiful singing emerges, a woman's voice delicately rendering a lullaby that fills the silence with haunting melody. Beneath this ethereal singing, a faint droning high-pitched noise becomes perceptible, adding an undercurrent of tension to the scene. The camera begins its journey, floating forward near the ground, moving incrementally yet deliberately toward the Arizona house, and the drone becomes less faint, increasingly blending with the singing. As the camera accelerates, the drone escalates in volume, gradually transforming until it reveals itself to be a human scream, piercing the auditory landscape. The approach to the Arizona house unveils a ladder propped securely against the structure, leading to a second-story window, intensifying the intrigue. With increasing velocity, the scream nearly buries the singing, amplifying the urgency of the scene. The camera hastens its approach to the house, irresistibly drawn toward the base of the ladder by the pull of the harrowing scream. Without deceleration, it ascends the ladder with force, propelled upward by the deafening scream's propulsion. Upon reaching the top, it crashes through the billowing white curtains of the open second-story window and enters the nursery, where Florence Arizona is revealed with her back to us, her body rigid as she releases a piercing scream over the crib. The view rushes toward her, closing the distance rapidly as she rotates, hands clamped tightly over her ears, her mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting shriek. The camera draws in for an extreme close-up, focusing intently on her gaping mouth and the wildly vibrating epiglottis within, capturing the raw intensity of the moment. Abruptly, the scene changes, the scream is silenced in an instant, and the previously obscured lullaby singing becomes audible once more. Morning light bathes the scene as perspiration beads on Hi's forehead, indicating his recent awakening as Ed gently paces back and forth, delicately bouncing the baby in her arms while singing a soothing lullaby. Hi rises from bed as the orange sun begins its upward ascent, its rumbling awakening the day. The sun's rumble is suddenly interrupted by the high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee of a strobe, indicative of a flash picture being taken. The perspective shifts to view over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder as he stands at his open front door, confronted by a group of press people assembled on the porch, their cameras poised and ready. An obie light mounted above a local TV news camera casts a glaring spotlight into the scene, while various flashbulbs intermittently pop, capturing the moment in a flurry.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches, momentarily disappearing before roaring over a rise and launching into the air, landing and speeding away as the scene shifts to a deserted twilight street near the Arizona house. As the Biker fades into thin air, eerie singing and a faint drone emerge. The camera glides close to the ground toward the Arizona house, the drone growing into a scream that nearly drowns out the singing as it races toward an open second-story window. It ascends a ladder, propelled by the scream, crashing through the window into a nursery where Florence Arizona stands over a crib, screaming. The camera zooms in on her shriek before the scene abruptly changes, silencing the scream and highlighting the lullaby. Morning dawns as Ed cradles the baby, singing softly, while Hi rises from bed, and the rumbling sun rises in the sky. This tranquility is broken by the sound of a strobe as Nathan Jr. finds himself facing a group of reporters, cameras flashing at the doorstep.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The Biker, a member of a notorious desert racing club known for its daredevil stunts, approaches, craning down as he draws near. As the crane descends, he momentarily disappears from view over the rise in the rugged terrain of the Arizona desert; then suddenly - ROAR - he tops the rise and, with wheels spinning from his custom-built dirt bike, becomes airborne. He crashes back down to earth in the foreground and roars away with the dust trailing behind. The scene shifts from the vast, barren desert to a twilight street where the Arizona house, a mid-century bungalow typical of the region, is located. The roar of the Biker's engine and the clank of his chains recede into the distance as he gradually dissolves into thin air, leaving us looking at the empty street and the faraway Arizona house, reminiscent of classic Americana architecture. Eerily beautiful singing, a woman singing a lullaby that echoes with haunting sweetness, emerges as the receding roar fades. Behind the singing, a droning high-pitched noise, similar to feedback from an old radio, is faintly audible. The camera begins to float forward very close to the ground, slowly moving toward the Arizona house. The high-pitched drone becomes less faint under the singing, as if signaling an impending climax, and the camera accelerates. The drone grows louder, revealing itself to be a human scream, an expression of terror or agony, as the approach to the Arizona house shows a weathered wooden ladder propped up to a second-story window. As the speed of movement increases, the scream nearly buries the singing. The camera rushes to the house, toward the base of the ladder, drawn in by the sustained scream. Without slowing, it hurtles straight up the ladder, propelled forward by the deafening scream. Reaching the top, it crashes through the white curtains of the open second-story window into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona, Hi and Ed's neighbor known for her dramatic outbursts, with her back to us, screaming over the crib. The view rockets toward her as she turns, hands pressed to her ears to dampen the sound, mouth stretched wide in an ear-splitting shriek, drawing in for an extreme close-up of her gaping mouth and wildly vibrating epiglottis. The scene suddenly changes as the scream is cut off. The singing previously covered by the scream becomes audible again. It is now morning, with perspiration beads on Hi's forehead as he stirs awake, as Ed walks back and forth, gently bouncing the baby in her arms and singing it a soothing lullaby. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun, rumbling like distant thunder, begins to rise perceptibly over the horizon. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the high-pitched ba-WEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr.'s shoulder, the baby they recently adopted under mysterious circumstances, as he stands at his open front door, facing a group of press people eager for a story on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in, and various flashbulbs pop, capturing the chaotic start to their day.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. The scene suddenly changes as the scream is cut off. The singing previously covered by the scream becomes audible again. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun rumbling begins to rise perceptibly. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the highpitched baWEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr's shoulder as he stands at his open front door facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in and various flashbulbs pop.

The view rockets toward her as she turns hands pressed to her ears mouth stretched wide in an earsplitting shriek drawing in for an extreme closeup of her gaping mouth and wildly vibrating epiglottis. The scene suddenly changes as the scream is cut off. The singing previously covered by the scream becomes audible again. It is now morning. perspiration beads on Hi's forehead as Ed walks back and forth gently bouncing the baby and singing it. a lullaby. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun rumbling begins to rise perceptibly. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the highpitched baWEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr's shoulder as he stands at his open front door facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in and various flashbulbs pop.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches craning down as he draws near. As the crane descends he momentarily disappears from view over the rise. then suddenly  ROAR. he tops the rise and with wheels spinning becomes airborne. He crashes back down to earth in the foreground and roars away. The scene shifts from the desert to a twilight street where the Arizona house is located. The roar of the Biker's engine and the clank of his chains recede as he gradually dissolves into thin air leaving us looking at the empty street and the faraway Arizona house. It is now morning. perspiration beads on Hi's forehead as Ed walks back and forth gently bouncing the baby and singing it. a lullaby. Hi gets out of bed as the orange sun rumbling begins to rise perceptibly. The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the highpitched baWEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr's shoulder as he stands at his open front door facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in and various flashbulbs pop.

The sun's rumble is abruptly snapped off by the highpitched baWEEEEeeee of a strobe going off as a flash picture is taken. We see over Nathan Jr's shoulder as he stands at his open front door facing a group of press people on the porch. An obie light over a local TV news camera glares in and various flashbulbs pop.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Painter ambles, tilting upwards as she meanders closer. As the balloon ascends, she briefly vanishes from sight under the horizon; then suddenly - SQUAWK - she crests the horizon and, with kites fluttering, transforms into a glider. She settles back onto the ocean in the background and shrieks onward. The moment shifts from the jungle to a dawn park where the Nevada cabin is found. The squawk of the Painter's echo and the clatter of her bracelets fade as she gradually morphs into dense fog, leaving us gazing at the vacant park and the distant Nevada cabin. Mysteriously haunting whistling, a man humming a dirge, arises as the fading squawk subsides. Beneath the whistling, a buzzing low-pitched hum is barely perceptible. The lens starts to hover backward very high from the sky, lazily drifting away from the Nevada cabin. The low-pitched buzz becomes more pronounced beneath the whistling, and the lens accelerates. The buzz intensifies, manifesting as a bird's squawk as the retreat from the Nevada cabin reveals a rope hanging from a rooftop chimney. As the pace of retreat accelerates, the squawk nearly eclipses the whistling. The lens dashes to the cabin, toward the top of the rope, pulled in by the resonant squawk. Without pausing, it zips straight up the rope, thrust forward by the piercing squawk. Reaching the summit, it bursts through the red drapes of the closed rooftop chimney into the attic, unveiling Samantha Nevada with her face to us, squawking beside the cradle. The view zooms away from her as she spins, hands clutching her eyes, mouth gaping wide in a teeth-chattering squeak, zooming out for a distant shot of her yawning mouth and gently shaking nostrils. The moment abruptly shifts as the squawk is muted. The whistling previously overshadowed by the squawk becomes discernible again. It is now evening, frost slickens Jo's cheeks, as Al strides sideways and sideways, lightly tapping the book and humming it a dirge. Jo leaps into the chair as the purple moon, humming, begins to fall noticeably. The moon's hum is suddenly interrupted by the low-pitched mmMMMoooo of a beacon flashing as a spotlight blinks. We peer over Olivia Sr.'s hat as he squats at his shut back door, ignoring a swarm of delivery folks in the garden. A neon sign under a distant radio satellite flickers out, and scattered sparklers ignite.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Biker approaches and momentarily vanishes over a rise before becoming airborne. As he lands and roars away, the scene moves from the desert to a twilight street with the Arizona house. The engine's roar and chains fade as he dissolves into thin air, leaving an empty street. A woman's lullaby emerges, accompanied by a faint high-pitched drone. The camera floats toward the Arizona house, with the drone intensifying into a scream. The camera speeds up, moving toward a second-story window. It crashes through curtains into the nursery, revealing Florence Arizona screaming over a crib. The view zooms in on her as the scream abruptly stops, allowing the lullaby to be heard again. It's now morning; perspiration beads on Hi's forehead as Ed sings to the baby. Hi rises as the sun noisily begins to rise, then abruptly stops with the sound of a strobe flash. Nathan Jr. stands at his open front door, confronting press people and camera flashes.
